intro: Euphrasia kanzanensis, commonly known as the Japanese toothwort, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in early spring. It has a rosette of oval, waxy leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
